member.summary: Provides AES128 encryption/decryption services

member.summary: Summary description for Ns.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.CryptoEx
member.summary: for stuff that was in bNb.Sec and hid in OpenNET

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeAttachment
member.summary: Used to specify the header and payload data for sending and receiving DIME attachments with the DimeSoapExtension.DimeExtension.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeAttachment.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new DimeAttachment.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeAttachment.#ctor(System.String,System.String,OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.TypeFormatEnum,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a DimeAttachment object
member.param: The unique id for the DIME record.

The type of payload data in the record. The format of this type is specified by the typeFormat parameter. For example, if typeFormat is TypeFormatEnum.MediaType then a valid type is "plain/text; charset=utf-8"
The format of the type parameter.
The stream for reading or writing the payload data.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeAttachment.Id
member.summary: The unique id for the attachment. When setting the id it will be converted into its canonical Uri format.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeAttachment.Type
member.summary: The type of payload data in the attachment. The format of this type name is specified by the TypeFormat property. For example, if TypeFormat is TypeFormatEnum.MediaType then a valid Type is "plain/text; charset=utf-8"

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeAttachment.TypeFormat
member.summary: The format of the Type property.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeAttachment.Stream
member.summary: The stream for reading and writing the attachment payload data.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeAttachmentCollection
member.summary: A collection of DimeAttachment objects.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeExtension
member.summary: A soap extension that provides DIME encapsulation of SOAP messages and sending and receiving of DIME attachments.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeExtension.BeforeSerialize(System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage)
member.summary: Collects the the set of DimeAttachment objects to send in the message. For referenced attachments these are collected from the parameter list or return value. For unreferenced attachments these are collected from the IDimeAttachmentContainter collections. The SOAP envelope and attachments are written into the network stream in the AfterSerialize method. If an exception has been thrown, the soap message containing the exception is not encapsulated.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeExtension.AfterSerialize(System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage)
member.summary: Encapsulates the SOAP message into a DIME message. The stored attachments are added as DIME records. If an exception has been thrown, the soap message containing the exception is not encapsulated.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeExtension.BeforeDeserialize(System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage)
member.summary: Retrieves the SOAP message from the DIME message. DIME attachments are removed from the stream and stored for future use by the AfterDeserialize method.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeExtension.AfterDeSerialize(System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage)
member.summary: Sets the method's DimeAttachment parameters and return value to the stored values.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeExtension.CheckAttachment(OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeAttachment)
member.summary: Validates the attachment.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeExtension.BinaryCopy(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Binary copy from one stream to another.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeExtensionAttribute
member.summary: Attribute to be used on the web method on the server and client proxy to enable the DimeExtension.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeReader
member.summary: Reads DIME messages from a stream as a series of DIME records.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a DimeMessageReader object
member.param: Must be an open readable stream.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeReader.ReadRecord
member.summary: Returns the next record in the DIME message in read-only mode. If the DimeReader is closed then an InvalidOperationException will occur. When the end of the message is reached ReadRecord will return null. ReadRecord is a blocking i/o call in that the DIME record header is read before the method returns.
member.returns: A read-only DimeRecord, or null if it's the end of the DIME message. If the record has TNF=None and it is the last record in the message null is also returned.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeReader.Close
member.summary: Close discards the remaining records in the message before closing. Close is a blocking call if all records haven't been read since it will

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord
member.summary: Represents the header and payload of a DIME record. DimeRecord is not directly creatable, they are created by DimeReader and DimeWriter when reading and writing DIME messages.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a read-only DimeRecord object.
member.param: Must be an open and readable stream.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Uri,System.String,OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.TypeFormatEnum,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a write-only DimeRecord object.
member.param: stream must be open and writeable.
id must be null or a valid URI.
type must be a valid URI or a media type.
contentLength is the length of the records content. If contentLength equals -1, chunking is used.
beginOfMessage marks this record as the first record in a message.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord.Close
member.summary: Closes the record. If writing a chunked record then any buffered data will be written out. DimeReader and DimeWriter will automatically close a record when starting to read or write the next one, or if DimeReader.Close() or DimeWriter.Close() is called.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord.WriteHeader(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int64)
member.summary: Writes the header to the stream.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord.ReadHeader
member.summary: Reads the header's properties from a stream

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord.BodyStream
member.summary: A stream for reading or writing the payload data of the DIME record. This stream will read from or write to the stream passed to the DimeReader or DimeWriter. However it is a different Stream instance because it has a different position, open/closed state, etc. When writing chunked messages the stream may be partially buffered, otherwise the writes will go directly to the underlying stream.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord.Chunked
member.summary: When reading a record this property indicates that this record is chunked.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord.ChunkSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum size of a chunk when writing chunked payload DIME records. Essentially this is the amount of buffering that will occur before the chunked payload is written to the underlying stream, the actual chunk size may be greater. The default value for ChunkSize is specified by DimeWriter.DefaultChunkSize.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord.ContentLength
member.summary: When writing specifies the payload length in bytes of the DIME record or -1 if the record is chunked. When reading indicates the length of the payload as specified in the DIME record header.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord.EndOfMessage
member.summary: When reading a record this property indicates that this record is the last one in the message. When writing a record the message end flag is automatically set when the DimeWriter is closed.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord.Type
member.summary: Specifies the type of the data in the payload. The TypeFormat property should be used to interpret the Type property. For example if TypeFormat is TypeFormatEnum.MediaType then a valid Type would be "plain/text; charset=utf-8" or "image/jpeg".

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord.TypeFormat
member.summary: Specifies what format the Type property is so that the format of the payload can be understood.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord.Id
member.summary: The id of the DIME record. Should be unique for all DIME records

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeStream
member.summary: DimeStream is used to read or write the record payload data through a Stream interface. The DimeStream delegates all of its work back to DimeRecord.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeStream.#ctor(OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeRecord)
member.summary: Creates a DimeStream object
member.param: A valid header for the DIME record.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads data from the stream. Returns 0 when the end of the record is reached. For chunked records, read will continue to read data, discarding the chunked record headers until the end of the chunked record set is reached. If Read() is called when the stream is closed, an exception is thrown.
member.param: The buffer the data is copied into.
The offset in the buffer to begin copying to.
The number of bytes to copy.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes to the stream. If ContentLength is exceeded, an exception is thrown. For chunked records, each write will generate a new chunked record if enough bytes are available to exceed the chunk size. If Write() is called when the stream is closed, an exception is thrown.
member.param: The data to be written.
The offset to write the data from.
The number of bytes to write.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeStream.Close
member.summary: Closes the stream. Read-only mode: If the number of bytes read is less than ContentLength, the remaining bytes are read from the stream and discarded. Write-only mode: If number of bytes written doesnâ€™t equal the ContentLength, an exception is thrown.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.IDimeAttachmentContainer
member.summary: IDimeAttachmentContainer is an interface used by the DimeExtension to get and set unreferenced DIME attachments. This interface can be implemented on the service or proxy to add support for unreferenced attachments.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeWriter
member.summary: Writes a DIME message as a series of DIME records to a stream.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeWriter.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a DimeWriter to write a DIME message to the given stream.
member.param: stream must be an open writeable stream

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeWriter.CreateRecord(System.Uri,System.String,OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.TypeFormatEnum)
member.summary: Returns the next record to write in the DIME message. The record payload will be written in chunked mode since no contentLength is specified. When the DimeWriter is closed then the message end flag is automatically set on the last record.
member.param: The unique identifier of the record in the form of a URI.

The type of payload data in the record. The format of this type is specified by the typeFormat parameter. For example, if typeFormat is TypeFormatEnum.MediaType then a valid type is "plain/text; charset=utf-8"
The format of the type parameter.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeWriter.CreateRecord(System.Uri,System.String,OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.TypeFormatEnum,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the next record to write in the DIME message. If the length of the payload data is not known upfront then use contentLength==-1 to specify chunked records. Otherwise the amount of data written to the record must match the content length specified. When the DimeWriter is closed then the message end flag is automatically set on the last record. If writing in non-chunked mode then an empty terminating record with TNF=TypeFormatEnum.None will be automatically sent when the DimeWriter is closed.
member.param: The unique identifier of the record in the form of a URI.

The type of payload data in the record. The format of this type is specified by the typeFormat parameter. For example, if typeFormat is TypeFormatEnum.MediaType then a valid type is "plain/text; charset=utf-8"
The format of the type parameter.
The count of bytes to be written to the DIME record, or -1 to specify writing a chunked payload record.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeWriter.Close
member.summary: Closes the DIME message. If writing chunked payloads then any buffered data is written to the underlying stream and the chunked record and message end flags are set. If writing non-chunked then a terminating empty record with TNF=TypeFormatEnum.None is written to end the DIME message..

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.DimeWriter.DefaultChunkSize
member.summary: Specifies the default chunk size in bytes when writing chunked payload DIME records. The default value for the DefaultChunkSize is 1024 bytes.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.Dime.TypeFormatEnum
member.summary: Specifies possible Type formats as defined in the DIME specification. For example, if the type format is TypeFormatEnum.MediaType then a valid Type would be "plain/text; charset=utf-8" or "image/jpeg".

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.pathHeader
member.summary: WS-Routing is a simple, stateless, SOAP-based protocol for routing SOAP messages over a variety of transports like TCP, UDP, and HTTP. With WS-Routing, the entire message path for a SOAP message (as well as its return path) can be described directly within the SOAP envelope. It supports one-way messaging, two-way messaging such as request/response and peer-to-peer conversations, and long running dialogs.
member.remarks: just keeping this around for WSE 1.0. WSE 2.0 uses WS-Addressing

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.pathHeader.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.param: Element that indicates the intent of the message in a manner akin to the SOAPAction HTTP header field defined for SOAP (required).
The ultimate receiver (required).
Element that indicates a relation with another message (optional).

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Web.Services2.SecConvHandler
member.summary: Summary description for SecConvHandler.
